goals.question: What is the distribution of state capitals by population?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of state capitals by population
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of population sizes of state capitals and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between the latitude and longitude of state capitals?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of latitude vs longitude of state capitals
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any patterns or clusters of state capitals based on their geographic location.

goals.question: What is the most common state capital name?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of the frequency of state capital names
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any commonalities or patterns in the naming of state capitals.

goals.question: What is the distribution of state capitals by region?
goals.visualization: Pie chart of state capitals by region
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of state capitals across different regions of the United States.

goals.question: What is the relationship between the population and area of state capitals?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of population vs area of state capitals
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is any correlation between the population and area of state capitals.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.sort_values(by='population', ascending=False)
    plt.figure(figsize=(15, 6))
    plt.bar(data['state'], data['population'], color='c')
    plt.xlabel('State')
    plt.ylabel('Population')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of state capitals by population?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=90)
    plt.legend(['Population'])
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    scatter = ax.scatter(data['longitude'], data['latitude'], c=data.index, cmap='viridis')
    ax.set_xlabel('Longitude')
    ax.set_ylabel('Latitude')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between the latitude and longitude of state capitals?', wrap=True)
    legend1 = ax.legend(*scatter.legend_elements(), title="State Capitals")
    ax.add_artist(legend1)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    capital_name_counts = data['capital'].value_counts()
    capital_names = capital_name_counts.index
    frequencies = capital_name_counts.values

    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    ax.bar(capital_names, frequencies)
    plt.xticks(rotation=90)
    plt.xlabel('State Capital Names')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the most common state capital name?', wrap=True)
    ax.legend([f'Most Common: {capital_names[0]} ({frequencies[0]})'])

    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    region_counts = data['region'].value_counts()
    plt.pie(region_counts, labels=region_counts.index, autopct='%1.1f%%')
    plt.title("What is the distribution of state capitals by region?", wrap=True)
    plt.legend(region_counts.index, title="Regions", loc="best")
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    ax.scatter(data['area'], data['population'])
    ax.set_xlabel('Area')
    ax.set_ylabel('Population')
    ax.set_title('What is the relationship between the population and area of state capitals?')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
